<Meta title="Docs/Theme/Getting Started" />

# Getting Started
Reablocks theming is managed in the theme section of your tailwind.config.js file.
It allowing you to tailor your design.
Within the theme, you have the flexibility to define colors, border radii, shadows, and font sizes.

It also provides Storybook blocks for you to use in your storybook.

## Example

Initalize it in the root of your application like:

```tsx
import { ThemeProvider, darkTheme } from 'reablocks';

export const App = () => (
  <ThemeProvider theme={darkTheme}>
    <YourComponents />
  </ThemeProvider>
);
```

Also you can extend the theme like:

```tsx
import { ThemeProvider, darkTheme, extendTheme, PartialReablocksTheme } from 'reablocks';

export const App = () => (
  const customTheme: PartialReablocksTheme = {
    components: {
      button: {
        base: 'bg-lime-600 text-gray-300',
        variants: {
          filled: 'bg-lime-600 hover:bg-lime-700',
          outline: 'bg-transparent border-lime-600 border',
          text: 'bg-transparent border-0'
        },
        sizes: {
          small: 'p-2',
          medium: 'p-3',
          large: 'p-4'
        }
      }
    }
  };

  <ThemeProvider theme={extendTheme(darkTheme, customTheme)}>
    <YourComponents />
  </ThemeProvider>
);
```

To define the custom tokens you can use tailwindcss like:

```ts
import { type Config } from 'tailwindcss';
import colors from 'tailwindcss/colors';

const config: Config = {
  content: [
    './src/**/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}',
    'node_modules/reablocks/**/*.js'
  ],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        primary: {
          50: '#f3f4f6',
          100: '#e7e9ed',
          200: '#c3c8d3',
          300: '#9fa6b9',
          400: '#565f86',
          500: '#0d1733',
          600: '#0c1530',
          700: '#0a1228',
          800: '#080f20',
          900: '#060c19',
        },
        secondary: colors.slate,
      }
    },
  },
};

export default config;

```
